intro: Wahlenbergia rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodes Island forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are erect and branched. Wahlenbergia rhodesiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
